meanings.definition: An area of territory owned or controlled by a ruler or government.
meanings.sent1: The king's domain included the castle and surrounding lands.
meanings.sent2: The forest was part of the queen's domain.
meanings.sent3: The domain of the ruler extended to the neighboring villages.
meanings.sent4: In the domain of the monarch, his word was law.
meanings.sent5: The domain of the ruler was vast and majestic.

meanings.definition: A specified sphere of activity or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: Mathematics is not within my domain of expertise.
meanings.sent2: The field of medicine is a complex domain.
meanings.sent3: Exploring the domain of art opened up new possibilities.
meanings.sent4: She delved into the domain of literature with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: Learning about different cultures falls within the domain of anthropology.

meanings.definition: A distinct subset of the Internet with addresses sharing a common suffix.
meanings.sent1: The website belongs to the .com domain.
meanings.sent2: Emails are sent and received within the same domain.
meanings.sent3: The domain of the website was easy to remember.
meanings.sent4: The domain name was unique and catchy.
meanings.sent5: Registering a domain is essential for creating a website.
